intro: Castanopsis uraiana, commonly known as the Uraian tallowwood, is a species of evergreen tree native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The tree typically grows in subtropical rainforests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and have a leathery texture, while its fruit is a cupule enclosing one or two nuts. Castanopsis uraiana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
